title: Archbishop of Canterbury Resigns Over U.K. Church Abuse Scandal
content: Justin Welby, the leader of 85 million Anglicans worldwide, announced his resignation days after a report found he had taken insufficient action over claims of abuse.
summary: Justin Welby, the leader of 85 million Anglicans worldwide, announced his resignation days after a report found he had taken insufficient action over claims of abuse.

title: A Former Harrods Employee Accuses Al-Fayed of Trafficking and Says His Brother Knew
content: In a U.S. court filing, a former employee says she was trafficked, raped and abused when Mohamed al-Fayed owned Harrods, and that his brother Ali may have evidence of the abuse.
summary: In a U.S. court filing, a former employee says she was trafficked, raped and abused when Mohamed al-Fayed owned Harrods, and that his brother Ali may have evidence of the abuse.

title: Mexico Signals It Could Hit Back With Tariffs at U.S.
content: Could a tariff war erupt between the United States and Mexico? A top Mexican official said his country might retaliate if the Trump administration placed steep tariffs on Mexico.
summary: Could a tariff war erupt between the United States and Mexico? A top Mexican official said his country might retaliate if the Trump administration placed steep tariffs on Mexico.

title: The UK’s Award-Winning Centenary Building May be Reduced to Rubble
content: A building once celebrated for its innovation is deemed obsolete. Those trying to save it ask what its demolition means for British architecture.
summary: A building once celebrated for its innovation is deemed obsolete. Those trying to save it ask what its demolition means for British architecture.

title: Germany Will Hold Snap Election in February
content: After the collapse of Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s governing coalition, the balloting will be held on Feb. 23, about seven months before it had been scheduled.
summary: After the collapse of Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s governing coalition, the balloting will be held on Feb. 23, about seven months before it had been scheduled.

title: Israel’s Bloody Cycle of War Against Hamas Returns to North Gaza
content: Israel said its forces had returned to northern Gaza to fight a Hamas resurgence. That has brought a new round of suffering for residents.
summary: Israel said its forces had returned to northern Gaza to fight a Hamas resurgence. That has brought a new round of suffering for residents.

title: Its Birthrate Falling, Russia Targets Child-Free Lifestyles
content: The country’s lower house of Parliament passed a law that would ban what it calls “propaganda” discouraging Russians from having children.
summary: The country’s lower house of Parliament passed a law that would ban what it calls “propaganda” discouraging Russians from having children.

title: Amsterdam Authorities Expect More Arrests Related to Attacks Around Soccer Match
content: So far, 62 people have been detained in connection with unrest surrounding a soccer match as officials said they continue to investigate antisemitic attacks, as well as incendiary behavior by both sides.
summary: So far, 62 people have been detained in connection with unrest surrounding a soccer match as officials said they continue to investigate antisemitic attacks, as well as incendiary behavior by both sides.

title: Italian City in Amanda Knox Case Wants to Move On. A New Series Won’t Let It.

title: Russian Doctor, Accused of Antiwar Stance, Is Jailed After Child’s Testimony

title: Russia and Iran Vie for Influence in the Caucasus Region
content: In the volatile Caucasus region, Russia and Iran, often seen as united in their aims, are vying to secure trade routes and influence. That leaves Western countries facing an unusual dilemma.
summary: In the volatile Caucasus region, Russia and Iran, often seen as united in their aims, are vying to secure trade routes and influence. That leaves Western countries facing an unusual dilemma.

title: Hanako Okada Beat the Odds to Upend a Male Political Dynasty in Japan

summary: Hanako Okada was one of 73 women to win seats at the general election last month, a record number in a Parliament long dominated by men.

title: Aid Deliveries to Gaza Remain Low Despite U.S. Warning to Israel

title: U.K. Plans to Fine Tech Executives for Illegal Weapon Sales Online
